revised_title: The Effect of Isotopes on the Thermal Conductivity of Dielectric Crystals
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the thermal conductivity of dielectric crystals, such as rutile, lithium fluoride, and potassium chloride, and found that the presence of multiple isotopes in the crystals can cause irregularities in atomic arrangement and lead to phonon scattering. They developed a theory explaining this effect and compared it with experimental results, showing satisfactory agreement.
